intro: Spiranthes novofriburgensis, commonly known as the Fribourgh spiral orchid, is a species of flowering plant in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America, particularly in Guatemala and Mexico. The plant is characterized by its delicate, spiral arrangement of flowers, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. The orchid produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn.
